meanings.definition: A highly contagious viral infection characterized by a red rash, fever, and cough.
meanings.sent1: The rubeola spread quickly through the school, causing many students to stay home.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can easily diagnose rubeola by looking at the specific symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The rubeola virus decided to throw a party in my body, but I wasn't invited!
meanings.sent4: The rubeola outbreak was like a wildfire, spreading rapidly from person to person.
meanings.sent5: The image of the red rash from rubeola is burned into my memory.

meanings.sent1: My doctor explained that rubeola is just another name for measles.
meanings.sent2: When I was a child, I had a case of rubeola that kept me in bed for days.
meanings.sent3: I told my friend I caught rubeola, and they thought I meant I found a rare gem!
meanings.sent4: The word 'rubeola' sounded like a mysterious spell from an ancient language.
meanings.sent5: Learning about rubeola helped me understand the seriousness of measles.
